channel.title: Mary Fallin
channel.description: Mary Fallin Governor of Oklahoma (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Thank you.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: President Ronald Reagan once said "there are no great limits to growth, because there are no limits of human intelligence, imagination, and wonder."
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: He believed, like I believe ­ like Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan believe ­ that the potential for America is limitless.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: We can ­ and we will ­ overcome any economic challenge if government lets go of the regulatory chokehold zapping the air out of the economy and deflating the spirits of our entrepreneurs.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: We need a president who will applaud and encourage those who work hard to pursue their dreams, to reach their potential, and, in doing so, make themselves and America better and stronger.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: That man is Mitt Romney.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: The history of my state of Oklahoma offers a great example of pursuing the American Dream. It was built and settled by pioneers moving West to seek better lives.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: During the great Land Run of 1889, thousands of families rushed to put a stake down on empty plots of land.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: They built tent cities overnight, they farmed the land, and they worked hard.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: And in 1897, eight years after the Land Run, a handful of adventurous pioneers risked their own money ­ not, the federal government's money ­ to drill Oklahoma's first oil well, the Nellie Johnstone.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: By doing so, these early-day pioneers changed the future and the fortune of Oklahoma forever, and today Oklahoma is one of the nation's key energy producers and job creators. President Obama wants us to believe that Oklahomans owe that success to the federal government: to the Department of Energy, to the EPA, the IRS or maybe even to him.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Mr. President, we know better.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: As we say in Oklahoma, that dog won't hunt.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: We owe these remarkable successes to the imagination and ingenuity of people like my friend, Oklahoman Harold Hamm.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: The son of sharecroppers, and the youngest of 13 children, Harold grew up in the small town of Lexington, Oklahoma.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: As a child, he helped out on the farm and went to school only after the first freeze or Christmas.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: While attending high school, he worked for a dollar-an-hour at a gas station.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: After high school, Harold took a job cleaning out oil barrels.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: At the age of 20, he bought his own truck and began a one-man, oil-field-service business.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: He made enough money to begin taking college-level classes in geology and mineralogy.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: At 26 years old, he drilled a wildcat well that produced 75 barrels of oil an hour.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: We call that a gusher.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Today, Harold Hamm is the Chairman and CEO of Oklahoma's own Continental Resources, a top ten U.S. producer of petroleum liquids with nearly 700 employees, operating in 10 states, and valued at over $13 Billion.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Now Harold and his company are helping to power cars, homes, and businesses across the nation.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Harold and other energy entrepreneurs have completely transformed the U.S.'s energy outlook. And with a President Romney, we'll end America's dependence on foreign oil.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: And create even more American jobs.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Harold's success story is not one-of-a-kind; it is an American dream that has been realized by countless men and women since the founding of this country.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: He is just one of the many visionaries and innovators in the private sector that are the true drivers of economic growth and job creation.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: And that's what President Obama just doesn't get. He'll tell you that "If you've got a business ­ you didn't build that. Somebody else made that happen."
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Well, Mr. President ­ like who? The IRS? The EPA? Or the federal government?
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: The president believes that government is responsible for our successes and that's why his solution to everything is more government, bigger spending, more regulation, and more bureaucratic programs like Obamacare.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: He says his plans are working, but look at the results:
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: 42 straight months of unemployment over 8%
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: 23 Million Americans out of work, underemployed, or no longer even looking for work
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: A nation threatened by nearly $16 trillion dollars of debt
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Families feeling pinched, not just by a bad economy, but by a President who promised hope and change, and left many Americans with no hope and just change in their pockets
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: President Obama believes the power of a Big Government is the key to American success.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Mitt Romney believes in the power of the people.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Mitt Romney understands that free enterprise and hard work ­ not government ­ have made the United States the envy of the world.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: He will reverse the tide of decline and promote economic security.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: He knows it's hard-working American families, not federal bureaucracy, that have built our great and glorious nation.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Mitt Romney is ready to lead. He has the experience and the vision we need to restore America's economy and its greatness.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: I am proud to support his candidacy for president, and as the next leader of the Free World; he will make us proud.
item.author: Mary Fallin

item.title: Thank you.
item.author: Mary Fallin
